intro: Leucopsidium arkansanum, commonly known as the Arkansas poppy, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in open woodlands and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. The Arkansas poppy is a short-lived perennial, often found in moist to mesic habitats.
